entry.title: Package Relay Proposal
entry.summary: The discussion in the email thread revolves around a scenario where a peer announces a package, but may not be honest about its fee rate or parents. The proposed solution is to include fee and weight information when announcing packages and encode parent transactions as short hashes to avoid round trips. There is also a suggestion to use a bit field for "version" in "sendpackages" instead of sending a message for each version. The overhead of using short ids for parent transactions is discussed, with the idea being more interesting for ancestors than just parents.
